intro: Heritiera novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea Heritiera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is characterized by its woody structure and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
